verbs.description: [ARG1: Guest Columnist Ben Stein] [V: is] [ARG2: a writing instructor at Cleveland State University and Lakeland Community College] . He has taught middle and high school , and has worked in primary and elementary school classrooms . He 's also a part - time communications associate at Policy Matters Ohio . Now that they have passed funding to get through the rest of 2018 , President Trump and his allies in Congress will begin sharpening their knives to slash federal programs that keep our kids healthy and safe : Trump 's 2019 budget proposal calls for deep cuts to the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program ( SNAP ) , Medicaid and housing assistance . President Trump would cut $ 213.5 billion from SNAP , which helps put food on the tables of over 700,000 households in Ohio , almost half of which include at least one child . He would gut Medicaid by repealing the Affordable Care Act 's coverage expansions . Medicaid covers 3 million Ohioans , including close to a million children . He would slash funding for Housing and Urban Development ( HUD ) by 14 percent , leaving nearly 84,000 Ohio households with kids in danger of being left out in the cold . These programs do n't only benefit the people who directly receive them . Every $ 1 the federal government spends on SNAP circulates ...

Now that they have passed funding to get through the rest of 2018 , President Trump and his allies in Congress will begin sharpening their knives to slash federal programs that keep our kids healthy and safe : Trump 's 2019 budget proposal calls for deep cuts to the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program ( SNAP ) , Medicaid and housing assistance . President Trump would cut $ 213.5 billion from SNAP , which helps put food on the tables of over 700,000 households in Ohio , almost half of which include at least one child . He would gut Medicaid by repealing the Affordable Care Act 's coverage expansions . Medicaid covers 3 million Ohioans , including close to a million children . He would slash funding for Housing and Urban Development ( HUD ) by 14 percent , leaving nearly 84,000 Ohio households with [ARG1: kids] in danger of being [V: left] [ARG2: out in the cold] . These programs do n't only benefit the people who directly receive them . Every $ 1 the federal government spends on SNAP circulates ...
